bioghist.p: The National Organization for Women (NOW) was founded in 1966 in Washington D.C. to help achieve equality for women in all areas of life. The Pennsylvania Chapter of NOW (known as Pennsylvania NOW) was formed in 1971 after many local NOW chapters had already formed across the state, and in response to organizing efforts to pass an Equal Rights Amendment to the Pennsylvania Constitution. As of 2006, the organization has over 9000 members and 30 local chapters.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of Pennsylvania NOW from the mid-1970s to the mid-1990s. Materials include subject files on a number of issues, such as abortion rights, sex discrimination in insurance, the equal rights amendment, AIDS, and comparable worth. The subject files include background articles and research, letters to legislators, brochures and flyers, press kits and press releases, and clippings. There is a small amount of administrative material for Pennsylvania NOW, records of the chapter's Political Action Committee, and printed materials and policy statements from the national organization.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
